metadata.title: CVE-2018-4300 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The session cookie generated by the CUPS web interface was easy to guess onLinux, allowing unauthorized scripted access to the web interface when theweb interface is enabled. This issue affected versions prior to v2.2.10.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-4300` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.11
cups-bsd - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.11
cups-client - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.11
cups-common - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.11
cups-core-drivers - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.11
cups-daemon - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.11
cups-ppdc - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.11
cups-server-common - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.11
libcups2 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.11
libcupscgi1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.11
libcupsimage2 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.11
libcupsmime1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.11
libcupsppdc1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cups package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.7.2-0ubuntu1.11').
